Race.SpecificTitle: City of Tallulah -- 7.53 Mills - CC - 10 Yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
City of Tallulah Proposition
(Police and Fire Departments)
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Tallulah, State of Louisiana (the "City"), acting under the authority of Article VI, Section 27 of the Louisiana Constitution of 1974, and other constitutional authority, continue to levy a special tax of seven and fifty-three hundredths (7.53) mills on all the property subject to taxation in the City (an estimated $104,405.95 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the tax for an entire year), for a period of ten (10) years, beginning with the year 2013 and ending with the year 2022, for the purpose of operating and maintaining the police and fire departments of the City and for constructing, maintaining and improving streets and bridges in the City?

Race.SpecificTitle: Mound FPD # 1 -- Serv. Chg. - BOC - 5 yrs.
Race.SummaryText:
Mound Fire Protection District No. 1 Proposition
(Service Charge Continuation)
Race.FullText: Shall Mound Fire Protection District No. 1 of the Parish of Madison, State of Louisiana (the "District"), levy and collect an annual service charge of One Hundred Twenty Five Dollars ($125.00) to be assessed persons owning each residential or commercial structure, whether occupied or unoccupied, located wholly or partly within the boundaries of the District, for a period of five (5) consecutive years, beginning with the year 2013 (an estimated $13,500 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the service charge for an entire year) for paying costs of fire protection services in the District, including the cost of acquiring, operating and maintaining equipment and facilities for such services, and, for assessing and collecting said charge, owners shall be assessed a charge for each such structure which they own, and each residential or commercial unit and each housing unit within a multiple dwelling structure shall be considered a separate structure, and a mobile home, as defined in R.S. 9:1149.2(3), shall be considered a structure, provided that persons owning mobile homes shall be assessed 80% of the service charge, as provided in Section 1502.4 of Title 40 of the Louisiana Revised Statutes of 1950, as amended?
